Name: Baseline
Description:
This example demonstrates how to customize the way items are rendered in the TimeLine portion of the control in order to add additional 
custom elements by creating a custom TimeLineVisualizationBehavior for Silverlight and WPF. The example shows how to create Baseline 
objects in the Timeline of the control that represent the assigned resource to a specific task in the iteration. The iteration Baseline
 is a summary of all Tasks Baseline intervals.
KeyWords: Baseline, customize, timeline, timelinevisualizationbehavior, task, summary, timeruler

Name: Bold Column's text for summary tasks

ExampleInfo.Name: Bold Column's text for summary tasks

Description: This example demonstrates how to set a custom FontWeight to the text in the CellTemplate of the Columns in the control based on if the task has children tasks.
KeyWords: Bold Column's text for summary tasks, custom, fontweight, celltemplate, grid

Name: Custom CellTemplate for tasks with children

ExampleInfo.Name: Custom CellTemplate for tasks with children

Description: This example demonstrates how to customize the CellTemplate base on the Tasks type. In the example in the CellTemplate the elements of the DataTemplate are customized based on the CanExpand property of the OriginalDataItem.
KeyWords: Custom CellTemplate for tasks with children, customize, canexpand, dataitem

Name: Connecting to Database
Description: This project demonstrates how to fetch data from database and populate the RadGanttView control with it. And then after modifying the gantt task, how to update the database accordingly.
KeyWords: Connecting to Database, sync, custom, customtask

Name: Custom Cell Templates
Description:
This project describes how to create a custom CellTemplate, CellEditTemplate, CellHighlightTemplate and CellSelectionTemplate 
for the ColumnDefinitions in RadGanttView control for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Custom Cell Templates, celledittemplate, cellhighlighttemplate, cellselectiontemplate

Name: Custom Drag Reorder Behavior
Description: This example demonstrates how to restrict the drag reorder of some tasks in the control with the use of a custom GanttDragDropBehavior. The example is available for both SIlverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Custom Drag Reorder Behavior, tasks, restrict, ganttdragdropbehavior, drag, drop, behavior

Name: Custom Gantt Task With Status
Description: This example demonstrates how create custom GanttTask in order to add a Status property for each task for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Custom Gantt Task With Status, add

Name: Dependencies Editing
Description: This project demonstrates how to create, edit and delete a dependency to a Task in the RadGanttView control using an RadAutoCompleteBox control for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Dependencies Editing, create, edit, delete, task, dependency, autocompletebox

Name: Drag Drop From External Source
Description: This example demonstrates how to create drag and drop functionality between external controls and the GridView part of the control.
KeyWords: Drag Drop From External Source, gridview, part

Name: Event Double Click
Description: This example demonstrates how to create double click on each GanttTask in the timeline for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Event Double Click, ganttask, timeline

Name: Expand/Collapse CheckBox inside the Tree Column's Header

ExampleInfo.Name: Expand/Collapse CheckBox inside the Tree Column's Header

Description: This example demonstrates how to add a CheckBox to the ContentTemplate of the ColumnHeaderContainer in order to expand and collapse the Tasks with sub Tasks in the control.
KeyWords: Expand/Collapse CheckBox inside the Tree Column's Header, contenttemplate, columnheadercontainer, tasks

Name: Grid Sorting
Description: This example demonstrates how to sort ascending or descending the task source of the RadGanttView by clicking on the grid header. This example is for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Grid Sorting, order, ascending, descending, header

Name: Global and National Holidays
Description: This example demonstrates how to create a custom TimeLineVisualizationBehavior in order to render multiple containers in the TimeRuler of the control. In the example the containers represent national and global holidays of 2013.
KeyWords: Global and National Holidays, custom, timeline, timelinevisualizationbehavior, render, multiple, containers, timeruler

Name: Import Export From And To MSProject

ExampleInfo.Name: Import Export From And To MSProject

Description:
This example demonstrates how to import XML MS Project files into RadGanttView and export RadGanttView to MSProject using the COM Interop binary Microsoft.Office.Interop.MSProject.

**Important:** The Microsoft.Office.Interop.MSProject binary is a primary interop assembly that interoperate with existing COM types. Because of that you need to have MSProject installed on your computer in order to use the export functionality of the example.
KeyWords: Import Export From And To MSProject, ms, com, interop, project

Name: Locking GanttDragDependenciesBehavior
Description: This example demonstrates how to create a custom GanttDragDependenciesBehavior for the RadGanttView control in order to disable the creating of dependencies from and to specific tasks.
KeyWords: Locking GanttDragDependenciesBehavior, disable, creating, dependencies

Name: Modified Tasks
Description: This example demonstrates how to implement a solution for setting a tasks as 'dirty'. A dirty task is a task whose properties have changed their initial values. You should note that when creating dependencies between Tasks via dragging, only the destination Task will be marked as dirty.
KeyWords: Modified Tasks, dirty, initial, dragging

Name: Not allowed drop target TimeRuler slots

ExampleInfo.Name: Not allowed drop target TimeRuler slots

Description: This example demonstrates how to create a custom GanttDragDropBehavior in order to achieve a behavior where drag and drop is not allowed in specific time frame slots of the TimeRuler of the control.
KeyWords: Not allowed drop target TimeRuler slots, ganttdragdropbehavior, drag, frame

Name: Pixels to PixelLength conversion
Description: This example demonstrates how the conversion between real Pixels and the PixelLength property of the RadGanttView control is calculated. You can enter pixels (double) in the TextBlock and press enter or the convert button to convert those Pixels into PixelLength and instantly see the result in the RadGanttView control. The same could be done by entering PixelLength (TimeSpan) in the TextBlock.
KeyWords: Pixels to PixelLength conversion, calculate

Name: Printing And Exporting
Description: This example demonstrates how to print the RadGanttView control's GridView and Timeline area for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Printing And Exporting, print

Name: Printing And Exporting Advanced
Description: This example demonstrates how to print the RadGanttView controls content to A4 format and lets you choose which area to be exported and if the Headers should be included. It also shows how to create a custom print preview dialog with the use of RadWindow that shows how the pages will look after printing.
KeyWords: Printing And Exporting Advanced, a4, format, headers, custom, print, dialog, page

Name: Project Deadline
Description: This example demonstrates how to customize the way items are rendered in the TimeLine portion of the control and add additional custom elements by creating a custom TimeLineVisualizationBehavior for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Project Deadline, customize, container, add, render, timeline, custom, timelinevisualizationbehavior

Name: 'Recurring' task on mutiple rows
Description: This project demonstrates how to create a 'recurring' Task in the RadGanttView control for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: 'Recurring' task on mutiple rows, custom, occur

Name: 'Recurring' task on single row
Description: This project demonstrates how to implement a 'recurring' Task in the RadGanttView control for Silverlight and WPF. The task which has recurrences is displayed on the same row and the drag and drop of its 'recurrences' disabled.
KeyWords: 'Recurring' task on single row, custom, recurrences, same, occur

Name: Start/End times EventContainers
Description: This example demonstrates how to use custom EventContainer instances in order to display labels for the Start and End time of each GanttTask except the milestone task.
KeyWords: Start/End times EventContainers, custom, display, labels, ganttask, milestone

Name: Summary task visibility toggle behavior
Description: This example demonstrates how to achieve a behavior with which the Summary task is hidden when its inner children tasks are visible and visible when they are collapsed.
KeyWords: Summary task visibility toggle behavior, hidden, inner, collapsed

Name: Summary Task Consistency
Description:
This example demonstrates how to achieve consistency between inner tasks and their parent Summary task. 
If a border's task Start/End property are changed the Summary task's Start/End properties will be updated accordingly.

This example is available for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Summary Task Consistency, inner, parent, update, stretch, shrink, start, end, change

Name: Task Deadline
Description: This example demonstrates how to customize the way items are rendered in the TimeLine portion of the control and add additional custom elements by creating a custom TimeLineVisualizationBehavior for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Task Deadline, customize, event, container, add, render, timeline, custom, timelinevisualizationbehavior

Name: Task Deadline Property
Description: The example demonstrates how to use and customize the built-in Deadline property of the GanttTask.
KeyWords: Task Deadline Property, customize, custom, default

Name: Task with a Resource
Description: This example demonstrates how to add a custom Resource property to the GanttTask and customize the way the tasks are rendered in the TimeLine, so that this Resource is displayed.
KeyWords: Task with a Resource,  custom, GanttTask, TimeLineVisualizationBehavior

Name: Task snapping DragDrop and Resize behavior

ExampleInfo.Name: Task snapping DragDrop and Resize behavior

Description:
This example demonstrates how to create a custom GanttDragDropBehavior and SchedulingResizeBehavior in order to create a Task snapping behaviors. In the example if you resize a task or drag it, its Start and End time will be snapped to 00:00.
The example is available for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Task snapping DragDrop and Resize behavior, customize, custom, GanttDragDropBehavior, SchedulingResizeBehavior, snap

Name: Tasks With Different Colors
Description: This example demonstrates how to color the tasks depending on a property of the task.
KeyWords: Tasks With Different Colors, depending, customize, customization, style

Name: How to extend the CurrentHour and interval indicators into the Timeline

ExampleInfo.Name: How to extend the CurrentHour and interval indicators into the Timeline

Description:
This example demonstrates how to vertically extend the CurrentHourIndicator and the interval markers into the Timeline of the control.

More details explanation of the use approach could be found here:
- For WPF: http://www.telerik.com/help/wpf/radganttview-howto-customize-the-timeline.html
- For Silverlight: http://www.telerik.com/help/silverlight/radganttview-howto-customize-the-timeline.html
KeyWords: How to extend the CurrentHour and interval indicators into the Timeline, extend, vertically, markers

Name: Zero Task Level Initially Collapsed
Description:
This example demonstrates how to create a custom InitialExpandBehavior that will collapse the 'Big Iteration' task and expand its children tasks
The example is available for Silverlight and WPF.
KeyWords: Zero Task Level Initially Collapsed, initialexpandbehavior, big, iteration, expand, expandbehavior
